detailsOfAchievement: Conservation of local natural resources, working for the economic uplift of the rural community, enabling the marginalized sector join the mainstream of life, over all empowerment of the society, welfare of the women and children are some of the agenda on the cards of our Trust. We have been appointed as Business Facilitator by State Bank of India- Madurai Module. We are working with 29 State Bank of India Branches Dindigul and Theni Districts. 2880 women self help groups (SHGs) have been formed sofar covering 45880 members and are practicing savings and credit management based on self and mutual help basis. These groups are spread across 680 habitations. These groups have been linked with State Bank of India and HDFC Bank Limited. More than 3280 educated and uneducated youth were trained towards their self employment during the last Seven years. Technical guidance and bank loans were provided to them to start their own income generating activities in the areas of Tailoring and embroidery, Fabric/ Glass/ pot paintings, Soft toys making, Catering Technology, Food products, Eco friendly products etc. To encourage the talented students and to educate the normal students and for adult-non formal education, we started a Tuition Center. We have promoted a Badminton Club in Ayyampalayam for rural students and youth . More than 1000 saplings were planted every year to enhance the environment equilibrium in our work area deeming it as part of our duty to the posterity. So far 7000 trees have been planted and maintained We are also implementing NABARD Assistant in Natural Resources Management Programmes through watershed approach in Ayyampalayam area in Dindigul District We have constructed Rural Sanitation Projects at Ayyampalayam funded by the ACWW, London

detailsOfAchievement: About SSN Institutions (Run by SSN Trust): It was established in the year 1996 on a campus of 250 acres. The SSN Institution has emerged as one of the best private educational institutions in the country in terms of academics, infrastructure, and extra-curricular achievements. The main aim of SSN is to make a positive difference to the society through education. The Institution offers eight B.E./B. Tech. degree programmes, eleven M.E./M.Tech. degree programmes and MBA. SSN College of Engineering organizes national and international conferences in various domains on a regular time scale to cater to the needs of contemporary researchers. We have 70% of faculty as doctorates and remaining are pursuing Ph.D. 140 faculty are recognized research Supervisors in various universities. As of now, the Institution has 4107 meritorious students, 400 Ph.D scholars (both full-time and part-time) and 277 dedicated faculty. Our faculty and students published 566 research papers in international refereed journals with high impact factor during the academic year 2015-16, and obtained 70 funded projects with a grant of Rs. 20 crore from various funding agencies so far. Our Institution is certified with ISO 9001 : 2015 and five UG and 5 PG programmes have been accredited by National Board of Accreditation for five years. The college has obtained Accreditation from NAAC with â€˜Aâ€™ grade for 5 years. SSN CE received the â€œBharatiya Vidya Bhavan National Award for an Engineering College having the Best Overall Performance for the year 2006â€ from ISTE. EDU-RAND ranked SSN 7th among all private engineering colleges in India. Also, SSN received Asiaâ€™s Best Private Institute Award for the year 2013 from World Consulting and Research Corporation processed by KPMG.

detailsOfAchievement: Tamil Nadu Board of Rural Development (TNBRD) The TNBRD implements various projects in Agri and allied fields for the upliftment of rural people mainly ryots. The Krishi Vigyan Kendras(KVK) run by TNBRD under the financial assistance of Indian Council of Agricultural Research,New Delhi viz., Vedapuri KVK in Thiruvannamalai district and Dr Perumal KVK in Krishnagiri distirct have been doing excellent works with major emphasis on technology transfer in agri and allied fields for the upliftment of rural people. The major programmes of the KVK include Front Line Demonstration, On Farm Testing, Short term training, Vocational training, Seminar and exposure visit. Till date more than 50000 famers have been benefitted through various programmes of aforesaid two KVKs. The beneficiary farmers have been running several agri business units and have become famous entrepreneurs. The two seminars on food processing organized by TNBRD under the financial assistance of Ministry of Food Processing Industries have become eye openers for the establishment of various food processing units in Thiruvannamalai and Krishnagiri districts. Total number of 400 farmers had participated and benefitted. Under the various governmental schemes like RSVY, SGSY, IWDP, DPAP, NAWDPRA, MEDP, the Exposure visits have been organized to various agri and horticultural research stations and agricultural industries all over India for the technical awareness of the farmers, through which total number of 3500 farmers mainly youths have been benefitted. Under the National Agricultural Innovation Project, the sub project on farming system for livelihood security of small and marginal farmers in disadvantaged districts of Tamilnadu is being implemented in Thiruvannamalai and Villupuram districts in collaboration with faculty of Agriculture, Annamalai University. More than 500 farmers and 600 landless labourers are benefitted through this project.

title: Tamilnadu Pengal Nala Sangam
detailsOfAchievement: Tamil Nadu Pengal Nala Sangam, Started in 1954 is a welfare organization working for the upliftment of disadvantaged women and children. The Sangam run by a small team of dedicated women from its inception has a number of service activities to its credit. Its aims and objectives centres around the upliftment of poor and needy girl children and deserted old women both economically and socially. Kamalamma Balakrishnan Old Age Home accommodates more than fifty elderly women, all above 60 years of age. To it is associated a well equipped hospice ready to take care of the sick poor women. Another recently added unit, adjacent to the Old Age Home is Palliative Care Unit with all modern facilities to admit terminally sick patients. The objective is to help them to live without pain in their last stage. The unit for the poor girl children, named Destitute Children Home consists of 150 inmates enjoying free boarding and lodging. They are attending either M.M. Primary School or Annai Hr.Sec.School, both units of Annai Ashram. The schools together has a strength of nearly 1000 boys and girls, children of daily wage earners. For tiny tots ranging 0-6 of below poverty line families we have Rajiv Gandhi National CrÃ¨che Scheme where 150 children have their pre-primary training. The Sangam also runs a mini computer centre with 12 computers and a tailoring unit. Children above 15 are given free coaching in these two job oriented sections. One of the projects undertaken by the Sangam was sponsored by Womankind World Wide London to bring about all round personality Development in women. The Institution has won the prestigious The Best Institution Award in 1997 from Government of Tamilnadu. In addition to the award of 1997, the Sangam won the Best Institution Award in 2008 from Tamil Nadu Government, for the best maintenance of our Old Age Home. Anyone and everyone who steps into the portals of the Sangam has only words of appreciation for the work that is going on in the Campus. The project now the Sangam envisages is to increase inmates of our Kamalamma Balakrishnan Old Age Home to one hundred.

detailsOfAchievement: TANSTIA FNF SERVICE CENTRE TFSC is a collaborative venture between Tamil Nadu Small Tiny Industries Association TANSTIA, Chennai and Friedrich Naumann Foundation FNF, Germany, established to promote entrepreneurship and to provide supporting services to MSMEs industries. The centre was inaugurated on August 26, 1992 by Shri. R. Venkataraman, Former President of India. Our Mission is to encourage new entrepreneurs and enable the Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises MSMEs attain all round capabilities and to lead the way towards high performance thereby enhancing their participation in the national and global economy. TFSC is an ISO certified professional organization providing different services like Training, Consultancy, Information and hand holding, to micro and small enterprises spread across the state of Tamilnadu. It was also choosen as the best Project under Information services to Small Scale Industries during Expo 2000 Hannover. TANSTIA being the Apex State Level Association for small industries has a cross section of members from different districts and different regions. It has more than 1500 individual members and all District Associations in its fold. TFSC works very closely with the District Associations. Apart from these associations, we have individuals from different places seeking our services regularly. Hence the reach for TFSC is far and wide. In addition TFSC works very closely with the other small enterprises promotional bodies both Government like TANSIDCO, District Industries Centres etc., and non Govt. and banks and others. This make us more reachable to many small entrepreneurs throughout the state of Tamilnadu. The Centre has a panel of around 250 consultants on various fields and through whom the Centre provides advisory services to entrepreneurs. The Centre also provides inhouse training programmes for the MSMEs industries on various topics like Kaizen and 5 S, Total Quality Management, Energy Management, Waste Minimisation, Cleaner Production etc. It also assists the MSME units to get ISO 9000 accreditation. TFSC has now acquired Gold rating from NABET, for its performance to SMEs. TFSC has taken up STED Project in Tiruvallur, Vellore and Kanchipuram successfully, since 2008. TFSC is a major assessing body for Modular Employable Skills scheme of the Ministry of Labour Employment. TFSC has been providing yeomen service to the MSME sector for nearly two decades now.
